message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This paper analyzes the impact of decentralized renewable energy projects in rural areas of India using data from the National Sample Survey and the Rural Household Energy Database.", "dataset": ["National Sample Survey", "Rural Household Energy Database"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the Global Terrorism Database and the World Development Indicators to explore the relationship between terrorist attacks and economic growth.", "dataset": ["Global Terrorism Database", "World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Food and Agricultural Organization's national accounts, we estimate the contribution of agriculture to GDP in selected African countries.", "dataset": ["Food and Agricultural Organization's national accounts"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This study investigates the effect of education on income inequality in Brazil using microdata from the National Household Sample Survey and controlling for various demographic factors.", "dataset": ["National Household Sample Survey"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Education"]}, {"sentence": "We use newly collected administrative data on firms in the apparel sector in Bangladesh and India to study the effects of export processing zones on job creation and working conditions.", "dataset": ["administrative data on firms in the apparel sector in Bangladesh and India"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Extractive Industries"]}, {"sentence": "This research examines the relationship between climate change and agricultural productivity in East Africa using data from the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We use a panel dataset consisting of household and community-level surveys as well as satellite data on land use and land cover to analyze the impact of a community-driven development program on forest cover change in Indonesia.", "dataset": ["household and community-level surveys", "satellite data on land use and land cover"], "topic": ["Environment", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses data from the International Monetary Fund, the World Bank, and the World Trade Organization to investigate the effects of trade agreements on global economic integration.", "dataset": ["International Monetary Fund", "World Bank", "World Trade Organization"], "topic": ["Regional Integration", "Trade", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the relationship between financial inclusion and poverty reduction in Africa using household survey data from the Afrobarometer and country-level data on financial sector development.", "dataset": ["Afrobarometer"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Health Organization and the Demographic and Health Surveys, we examine the determinants of maternal health outcomes in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This paper analyzes the impact of decentralized renewable energy projects in rural areas of India using data from the National Sample Survey and the Rural Household Energy Database.", "dataset": ["National Sample Survey", "Rural Household Energy Database"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the Global Terrorism Database and the World Development Agriculture.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We use a panel dataset
